result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A. DVORAK

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CM 144, 15 CM 172 and 15 CM 178.  Motion granted.
The $50.00 cash bail is transfered to 15 CM 172 and applied to court costs.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-17-15 at 4:00 p.m.   Plea date is set for 07-20-15 at 10:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
Initial appearance is reset to 03-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.

At 5:00 p.m., $50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of obstruct officer and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-23-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
